Indian organizations support three-point charter of Korea's reunification 
     Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The signature paper supporting the three-point charter of Korea's reunification was signed on July 4 by chairman of the All-India Youth Federation Sitaram Sharma on behalf of 2,500,000 members, by former member of the autonomous council of Delhi A. K. Chawhan on behalf of 50,000 residents in Kalyanpri, Delhi State, by general secretary of the All-India Veteran Committee A. P. S. Chawhan on behalf of 10,000 veterans and by the president of Namata Barati International School of India on behalf of teaching staff and students.
